title: Center City Summer 2022 Lease Transfer
description:
I am moving to San Francisco, and am looking to sublet/lease transfer my Center City apartment for the summer.
Avenir Apartments (15th and Chestnut Street) -- modern 600 ft 1b/1b. Apartment is equipped with in-unit washer/dryer, dishwasher, central A/C and heat, pet friendly, and includes amenities like a gym and office spaces. Right next to City Hall and a quick walk to Rittenhouse + fun restaurants/bars!
Sublet dates: May 18th (flexible) to August 7th (with option to extend lease!)
Price: $1,800/month + utilities but willing to flex on price
I will be moving the bedroom furniture and the couch with me, but otherwise the option to include the rest of the living room furniture.
Video tour of the unit: https://api.realync.com/s/Ab6zULvaK
Please Message if you or anyone you know might be interested in subletting (or if you have any questions)!

Plenty of parking and close proximity to great restaurants and shopping.

title: ALL UTILITIES INCLUDED! Studio in Great Location
description:
This lovely studio apartment in the Belmont Hills / Bala Cynwyd / Manayunk area is available this June with ALL UTILITIES INCLUDED!
This apartment also comes completely FURNISHED! Included in the furnishings are a Serta Perfect Sleeper full-sized mattress, love seat sofa, dresser, desk, high-top table and chairs set, all window treatments, and ALL kitchenware, including complete Cuisinart pot set.
A full-sized bed loft creates a walk-in style closet space underneath!
Large windows with wide sills flood this apartment with natural light. Flooring is beautiful hardwood-style laminate and bathroom and FULL SEPARATE KITCHEN have ceramic tile. There is also a gorgeous built-in bookshelf in the main space.
Appliances include fridge, dishwasher, built-in microwave, gas stove, air conditioning, and free washer/dryer in the building.
Another huge plus to this apartment is that ALL UTILITIES ARE INCLUDED in the rent!  These include water, laundry, off-street parking, trash removal, high-speed internet, heat and electricity!
This LOCATION IS PERFECT: You can be an 8-minute walk to all the fun and shopping of Main Street in Manayunk and the Septa train to Center City and Conshohocken and right off the entrance to the 76 expressway.  Steps away are the Schuylkill River Trail and Cynwyd Heritage Trail for beautiful hiking, dog walking and biking. Experience it all without having to live in a cramped row home or pay high Philadelphia taxes!
This historic, stand-alone building has a parking area, large fenced-in yard with community grill and fire pit, and a furnished front porch (with hammock!).
This is a friendly, owner-occupied building, so you can be sure that we like to take good care of the place and our tenants. Feel free to email or text me, Rachel, so we can set up a time for you to come by and visit this great home!
I look forward to meeting you!

title: Norris Square Park Townhouse
description:
For rent starting June 15 is a 2500-square-foot, three-story, 4-bedroom, 2.5 bath historical townhouse on Norris Square Park with a large back garden. The house has high ceilings, a sun room, sliding glass door to garden/back entrance, many charming historical details, and central heat and air-conditioning. Plenty of basement storage. Can be partially furnished. Four roommates can live here with ample space!
Two blocks from the Berks subway station, the location is also in comfortable walking distance to many Fishtown and Kensington spots including Evil Genius Brewery, Martha, Loco Pez, Riverwards Produce, The Monkey Bar, Suraya, Grace & Glory Yoga, Pizza Brain, Little Baby’s, The International, etc.
Much of the place has been recently renovated: the kitchen was redone in 2016 and so were the wood floors throughout. The shared bathroom was renovated in 2021, and there’s a new shower in the master bath. All of the windows have been replaced, as well as other improvements.
My husband and I own/manage this property together, and we are very responsive and considerate landlords. We are looking for at least a year-long-lease, and rent could be negotiable in exchange for a longer lease term. Electric and gas are paid by the tenant; water is paid by the landlord. Amount due to move in will be a one-month deposit, plus the first and last month's rent.

title: Why Rent When You Can BUY!
description:
There are many benefits to owning a home. One of those amazing benefits is that you get something valuable with EVERY payment you make. That valuable asset is called Equity, and that is money basically going back to you which simply builds up over time. When you are renting, the money you spend isn't benefiting you at all, it's just making your landlord richer.
If you want or are considering purchasing a home but aren't sure how, feel free to send me an email and I'd be glad to help and walk you through the process.
Mikelle Marshall - Realtor
Keller Williams Philly

Additional Neighborhood info.
Not to be confused with Northeast Philadelphia, North Philadelphia East encompasses the smaller subsets of Ludlow, Yorktown, West Kensington, Poplar, and Callowhill. This composite area runs from the Vine Street Expressway, stretching north to Erie Avenue. Broad Street acts as its eastern border, and the western edge runs a jagged line separating North Philadelphia East from the nearby Kensington, Port Richmond, and Fishtown neighborhoods. With such a long stretch of city, the neighborhood offers a diverse blend of important city landmarks, such as renowned musical venues the Electric Factory and Union Transfer, and Temple University, North Philadelphia's premiere site of higher learning.
